meanings.definition: Cook (food) partially or completely before its final preparation.
meanings.sent1: I like to precook the pasta before adding the sauce.
meanings.sent2: It is common to precook the vegetables for stir-fry dishes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chef precook the chicken? To save time!
meanings.sent4: She decided to precook the rice to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the precooked bacon filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To prepare food in advance by cooking it partially or completely.
meanings.sent1: Before the party, she will precook the lasagna for convenience.
meanings.sent2: You can precook the meatballs and freeze them for later use.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would precook the entire week's meals in one day.
meanings.sent4: The idea to precook the soup and reheat it later was a time-saving hack.
meanings.sent5: The precooked chicken made dinner preparation a breeze.
